title: POGIL-Based Engineering Problem-Solving Education Design Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Practical workshop where pre-service teachers design engineering problem-solving-centered curricula using the POGIL approach. Emphasis on smartphone-based research and collaborative activities

learning_goals: Learners can apply the 4-stage POGIL model (exploration-conceptualization-application-evaluation) to engineering problem-solving
Learners can develop problem-solving projects using learner-centered question design strategies
Learners can derive solutions to real-world engineering problems through literature review and data analysis
A team-based feedback system can be established to evaluate the achievement of learning outcomes (POs).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
